info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 07 at 3:21PM PST until December 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT... -For the Winter Weather Advisory, Snow expected with accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected, with higher amounts above 4500 feet, and winds gusting as high as 35 mph. -For the Winter Storm Watch above 3000 feet, heavy wet snow possible, with snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches. Higher snow amounts will be possible in the higher terrain up to 25 inches. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph and cause reduced visability due to blowing snow. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, including highway 3 south of Callahan. For the Winter Weather Watch, this also includes Fort Jones. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High snowfall rates of 1"/hr are likely, especially in the higher terrain. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov or latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
